page.title: 15 Societies in Lamberhurst
page.content: For a small village, Lamberhurst has a wide variety of{clubs}and{societies. The sports clubs have a large{field} behind the{Memorial Hall}in which most of the indoor societies meet. Local opinion is divided as to whether the village can afford to demolish and greatly extend the present facilities. For{children}there are a playgroup and dancing classes. Brownies, cubs, guides and scouts meet in the school. For the{energetic}there is a keep fit club; matches for cricket and football teams; or bowls at a more leisurely pace. The Playing Field Association keeps an eye on all users. Other{ {interests}catered for are the Parent Teacher and Gardeners Associations; the Local History, Choral and Pantomime Societies; the Royal British Legion; the Women's Institute and the Darby and Joan Club.
